title: Faulty

review: I haven‚Äôt encountered any glaring problems with this app. Yes, UI is different from the older one but that‚Äôs not enough reason to give it a 1 or 2 star rating. At the end of the day, the app works and it meets the basic functionalities for online banking.
title: I don‚Äôt understand the low rating

review:
Although I appreciate the take to redesign the UI to a more modern look, it feels like it became less functional.

What irks me the most that led me to write this review is that it did not have a paste function that would make inputting account numbers much easier. For a new app, you would think this basic function would be available. 

Also, bank transfer attempts failed because my mobile key was still installed in the old app. However, when I tried in the old app, it pushed through. I just uninstalled this as I do not see the point. 

Unless you make this more functional, I don‚Äôt see the point of making a new app.
title: Modern design but less functional

review: I started using this new app but it had failed me in transferring money to other banks in several occasions. Good thing that the old app is still working, since I have no problem with it. title: Ewallet transfer issue

review:

review:
This is definitely still a beta version, otherwise it would have just been an update to the existing app rather than a whole new app. 

The scaling of the app is unrefined, so it looks weird on larger iPhones. None of the new features mentioned in the press releases are available already. The investments tab is not working as of this writing (it works on the old app). ‚ÄúAI-powered personal finance advisor‚Äù also sounds like a gimmick at best.
title: Still a Beta

review: It would be ideal if the mobile app had an option to lock a credit card and request a credit limit increase. review:
The App is great. However there's a small bug.

Steps to replicate
1: Open BPI App
2: [My Accounts] Go to Credit Cards section
3: Select and Click a Credit Card from this list
4: [Inside the selected credit card] Scroll Down to the "Credit cards in this customer number" section and Click on any Credit Card to view Transaction History
5: Press the Back Button (to go back to the Page on Step 4)
6: Press the Back Button to go back to [My Accounts] page. But it won't work

review:

Should allow copy/paste in fillable tabs like the old app. Easier to fill up for reoccurring transactions. 

Preferred status should be visible so users can keep track of their status.
title: Needs Improvement

review:
Confusing not user friendly 
I was sketchy when I cashed in to an e wallet knowing that it exceeded my daily limit which I didn‚Äôt know since I am an app user ever since 
This new app has lots of changes without informing users need to click lots of options before you go to your desired option
title: Confusing

review: Have the developers only lived in the Philippines? Why are OFWs never taken into consideration how this app works? I have my sim here from the ph but Globe has no signal here  in Turks and Caicos. I‚Äôm using local number here and my old BPI works really well. I transfer online my remittance and use my old bpi app to disburse the money in the ph from here. Do you expect me to fly home so I could use the app? Just so I can register this device? This app is poorly thought out.
title: Poorly thought out.

review:
The choice of font and spacing in the app is unbelievable.
The older app is really good but this one is hard to navigate and hard to comprehend.
In the old app, the user would be directed to the balances of accounts - meaning it has a good ui. In this app, it will take time for the user to comprehend about the important contents of the page.
You need to invest in your UX team. Cant believe that this is a big big downgrade from the previous app.
title: Poor User Experience

review:

Sana inayos niyo muna yung new app to the last bug before rolling it out for your customers. Nakakairita. ü§¨
title: I can‚Äôt push through with a transfer

review:

review:

Regardless, this app still works perfectly. For now I‚Äôll just stick with the aesthetically pleasing older app.

So, I was looking forward to what this new app will bring but daaaayyym! This new app is such a disappointment. The UI is worse than the old app. The navigation and icons are terrible. My notifications aren‚Äôt coming in despite the settings being correct. Gosh there are too many issues to mention. Please fix this ü•πü•πü•π

The app is requiring me to insert my registered sim card into my iPhone. Unfortunately, my device is sim-locked to a specific network provider. This means I am unable to register my iPhone as a recognized device. 

Yes, I get that it‚Äôs a security feature; but it shouldn‚Äôt be an inconvenience to your users. Please come up with better ways on how to maintain security.

‚Ä¢ this material design look is not enticing.

2. Have a dispute transaction or convert to SIP in app for that specific transaction. That will lessen the burden of using contact centers or hassle to customers

review: I have both BPI app and non of them has lock card feature. I find it very important knowing that we have issue of fraud in the past on this bank. I have other bank app and they have that feature, i dont see why this bank can afford to create 2 application but did not put lock card feature.

title: I like the old one better.

review:
please, one more change: the font used in the account number is more readable than that used in the values. 

the app now has almost all of the functions we are looking for, in different places... however, it is difficult to jump on a new one when one cannot read one of the more important values.

salamat
title: UI request

review: I like the old one better. This one doesn‚Äôt have faceID for logging in yet, and transferring money to Gcash now has a 25pesos service charge ü•≤ But there‚Äôs always room for change  so hoping for better updates in the future

However, now that I am using this new app in favor of the old one, the Mobile Key does NOT trigger which leaves my transaction security confirmation online to expire. Which is very frustrating. I‚Äôve tried reactivating the Mobile key feature with this new app over and over and still same error.

To the QA team, you should have tested this first before deploying this app. Not sure why you passed this.

review: We, valued customers, sincerely request to allow the paste values in recipient account number recipient in order to lessen the chances of encoding wrong account number. Please kindly include it on your new app just like what we had on old app for more convenience. Thank you so much.

review: Nice App. user friendly easy to navigate. The app has a lot of additional features that can able to help the lives of the account holders to make their transactions more convenient.

review: I much liked the design and UI/UX of the old app which was even personalized for BPI Preferred! This new app may have the same functions, but it doesn‚Äôt tell you anymore if you‚Äôre Preferred level. I also found a few issues if you‚Äôre not careful. If you send or transfer money after midnight, when its the next banking day, your balance may reflect missing funds. I experienced this if you have a current balance with a floating check that still needs to be cleared for example, or if the app goes under maintenance right after you transfer Instapay or load an e wallet. This is scary as sometimes your total balance is lower than when you last visited, and the statements are not even updated right away. If you don‚Äôt have a passbook, this is concerning as you have no idea where the funds were. I also had FIVE occasions when significant sums of money did not end up transferred in an e wallet like Maya or GCash using Instapay and needed to contact customer service, who are just reassuring that it will be credited back in a few days but won‚Äôt help you further. To sum it up: 1. Lackluster design 2. Caution when using the app in early morning hours or after 10pm. 3. If internet connection is poor or unstable (low signal mobile data is what affected me sometimes) don‚Äôt even dare transfer a big amount to a bank or ewallet or else risk waiting DAYS to get your money back. BPI used to be stellar in their digital app but now it seems every time something new arrives, it just doesn‚Äôt seem to work. At least this BPI app is MILES better than another bank‚Äôs app who shall not be named. Hint, it also starts with a ‚ÄòB‚Äô.
title: Your old app was better!

review:
The app is fast and smooth, the face recognition is quite responsive and app feels secure but the old app UI is better and easier to navigate,

This new app LACKS BASIC features such as adding other bank accounts from other banks as favorites and putting nick names for easier credit identification.

When you add the favorites feature and you need to require relationship please do include the option ‚Äúothers‚Äù in the drop down and give the user capability to so we can key in ‚ÄúMy Other Account‚Äù or best to put that as part of the drop down option instead of forcing us to use sibling or relatives which is promoting lying which is not good since we are just trying to transfer to our other accounts.

Such an inconvenience to always key in account details when you send money to other bank accounts and client is expose to human error hence having to call cs for reversals. 

Credit Card lock and unlock is really needed specifically that nowadays hacking and holdup are rampant it would be good to have those features in our fingertips.

It would be best to focus your time and resources on the feature improvements that really affect client experience rather than the UI. Metrobank and was able to transit their clients to the new app and their favorites options is working well same goes for security bank app (though their apps are slow) but having those features make me want to pay all my bills and do all my transfer using their banks because it is just so convenient.

These are the things that matter. Proactive approach is better than reactive.
title: So much improvement is needed

review: I like the new and modern minimalist UI design of the app, this can be improved. A couple of suggestions though: 1. Transaction History Details - It would be better if in the Transaction History, you can click a specific transaction and it will show your A MORE DETAILED INFORMATION like exact date and time, type of transaction, amount, merchant name (for payment transactions), originating bank name, bank account number and bank account name and destination bank name, bank account number and bank account name (for fund transfer transactions) It will be helpful for those who keeps track of their bank account transactions and also tp help in cases of disputes or concerns needing a "transaction proof" or needing more info abount the transaction in question 2. Ability to add or save PAYEES (for fund transfers), whether other BPI accounts (not under client's name) or bank accounts from other banks and ability to add or save BILLERS (for bills payments or load e-wallet transactions) You may check the PNB Digital App for the two suggested functionalites for your reference. You may also check other banking apps that has good reviews like Unionbank with it's good UI and with complete functionality and app features. At this day and age, most SHOULD and CAN BE done online. Provide more sel-service options in the app for your clients. Everything should be done through the app. Who doesn't have smartphones nowadays?! At least what can be done at the web version ba also available in mobile AND MORE! Dont restrict your clients with some limited options or few features they can do in the app, think of ways client can maximize the app and do EVERYTHING in the app. The app should be complete and flexible to cater to your clients' needs. CONVENIENT, SAFE, SECURE, INTUITIVE, STABLE and a COMPLETE PACKAGE mobile app. Is that too much to ask?!!
title: Transaction History Details and Adding Payee and Billers

review:
I would like to take this opportunity to provide some feedback on your new mobile banking app. As a long-time customer, I truly appreciate the time and effort BPI has invested in creating a new and improved banking experience for its users.

Firstly, I would like to commend the bank for the sleek and user-friendly design of the app, as well as the addition of new features that make managing my finances much more convenient. The improvements to the user interface and the overall performance of the app have significantly enhanced my banking experience.

However, there is one feature that I believe would greatly benefit users like myself, which is currently not available in the app. With multiple similar transactions being made regularly, it can sometimes be difficult to identify the specifics of each transaction and ensure their legitimacy. To address this issue, I kindly suggest incorporating an option to add a side note or memo to each transaction. This feature would allow users to easily differentiate between transactions, track their expenses more efficiently, and confirm the legitimacy of the transactions in question.

Adding this feature would undoubtedly improve the functionality of the app, and I believe that other BPI customers would find it just as valuable as I would. I trust that the BPI team will consider this suggestion and continue to work towards delivering an even better banking experience for its users.

Thank you for your attention to this matter, and for your ongoing commitment to providing excellent service. I look forward to the continuous enhancement of the BPI app and banking experience.
title: Appreciating Improvements and Suggesting a New Feature

review:
New app does not allow you to register more than one device. They decided for their convenience that only one device should be registered for security purposes. Now if your only device gets lost, you cannot lock your accounts or cards. It won't allow you to log in from another device. They're taking the safest route for security because they cannot be bothered to level up their security for multiple devices. 

Their device registration that sends an SMS won't allow you to multitask. So if someone sends you a message and you accidentally touch it and it goes to a different app. You have to do everything all over again. Not too sure how that's the best practice for 2023. 

Obviously no user research was done and the one doing the decision for the app's direction is the boss. Just like all other banks in PH. Boss probably doesn't know he/she is not the only intended user. Nor everyone related to him/her. #TrueStory

Font size is too big. The person next to you can easily read everything without struggling. There are two buttons that go to the same screen. Not sure if it's a mistake or it was an intentional filler. 

I like that the developer now says BPI. Would be great too if you applied the same whenever you reach out to your clients, instead of a random number. 

While the new look is refreshing, you forgot about those users who cannot adapt too easily to something new. Plus the fact that you don't have an onboarding on the app itself. It's good that you haven't killed the old app yet. 

Newly built in house team's birthing pains I surmise. Still a baby. Struggling with all the dinosaurs.

review:
Review

I am having an issue with registering my mobile in the new app. Understandable that some process is part of the security, and when I am need to register my phone to the app I, part of registration is to send a text message to BPI but my sim card is GOMO so I am not able to send the text message because my service in GOMO is like postpaid ish rather than prepaid, so I am not able to register my phone to the new app, even tho the send text message failed, my old BPI app is notifying me that register successfully, It is a bit confusing.

Listed below are the hassle that the new app caused:

Old BPI app is better (don‚Äôt fix it if it ain‚Äôt broke) 
Minimalism is not always a go to, (BPI is trying to follow the trend for a clout) this is the part that BPI forgot UI - UX, minimalism is a trend that BPI trying to follow but failed miserably. Do not always follow the trend.
As a mandatory to transition to use the old app to the new one, BPI forgot check all the information before implementing the app, they should have include all sim card (wether it is prepaid or postpaid) as I am not able to register my mobile because my number is GOMO.
Following the registration issue, the customer service rep of BPI advised to change my number that it is already registered in BPI and other services outside BPI. Do I really need to change my phone number just to use the new APP, BPI became incompetent on this part and it is very frustrating,
The new app does more harm rather than good.
My advice: why don‚Äôt you set up a research team to furnish you service including the app, set up a research team to study the best practices in the world to deliver best services.

review:
I understand that BPI is trying to modernize the look of their app but ironically, this new app doesn‚Äôt follow modern design standards. Right now, it feels and looks more like BPI downgraded (unpolished, made by beginner dev / uiux team) from their very polished old app. Recommendations: 1. Transitions upon interacting with the app itself are unpolished: (1.1) Collapsing and uncollapsing the accounts would nudge the account menu up and down. This leads to a very unpolished / rushed look. (1.2) Animations when switching across screens via the bottom menu buttons. Right now, tapping each icon feels more like a powerpoint interaction rather than app. Most apps 

2. Service setting icons all look the same. There‚Äôs a balance that you have to achieve between ‚Äúgiving icons a similar look‚Äù and ‚Äúmaking each icon distinguishable‚Äù. If icons are not effective in giving information, stick to the classic vertical menu instead. 

3. Cluttered / Not knowing where to look. Need to guide the users eyes: In most apps and in BPI‚Äôs old app, you would easily know where to look because of typography. EG: The account label is in a much heavier font weight, relative difference in font size is larger also vs other details. Clearer between the different accounts can also play a part in this. Compared to other apps, BPI decided to show the accounts as a table rather than separate account cards. 

4. Test your app with more people. I‚Äôve collected feedback from my own friends and they aren‚Äôt keen on BPI‚Äôs new app. From this small sample alone, dissatisfaction is already clear especially with the lack of features and functionality. If feedback was effectively collected internally within BPI, dissatisfaction might have been detected early before releasing the app to the public. Better yet, BPI should have collected feedback from external testers.

See for inspiration: (1) Banking / Finance apps: Unionbank, Maya, DBS (2) Design: UI UX websites; Dribbble.com / Behance, Apple Design Awards
title: UI needs improvement and app was launched without new features

review: I have the old mobile app before which works fine until lately that it was lagging. I changed phone/device and need to download the new mobile app. I need to set up my credentials and for no notification or what not I was asked for my passcode which I have no idea. I called customer service, the first rep walked me through and confirmed over the recorded line that a passcode will be sent to my registered phone which she confirmed the number. I tried logging in and yes it as for the 6 digit passcode sent to my number but voila, no passcode is received. I waited and waited and nothing. I called in and was advised that my phone number was not updated? Like seriously? I went to the branch as advised before, they updated my phone number, been using the mobile app and been receiving otps on this number and yet these reps advised me that it is not updated? ok, request to update, guess what no advise nothing, and been 2 business days right, but nothing. I used to love metrobank but I swear once my access is ok, I will transfer my funds and will close my metrobank account. Never thought that it can be this stressful to access your own money.

You need to remember this passcode as it will be required in every transaction.\\r\\n\\r\\nWe would like to remind you that online transactions require two codes: (1) first is your Metrobank Passcode; (2) second is the One-Time Password (OTP) sent via SMS.\\r\\n\\r\\nTo assist you further in resetting your passcode, kindly call our 24/7 Customer Service Hotline (+632-88700-700 or domestic toll-free number 1-800-1888-5775) and select Option 2 (Bank Related). review: For a bank who claims to be ‚ÄúThe Best Managed Bank‚Äù, they failed big time on this app. Signup is a hassle. After signup, you‚Äôll experience a very slow app. Its also buggy, I cannot transfer money because it is saying I have insufficient balance even if I have enough in my account. The UI/UX maybe good but the QA failed to test all loopholes before releasing this app. Developers did not even bother fix the issue despite the 1 star rating of their app. Metrobank really is disappointing, even their physical banks are also slow in service. Maraming nang tao sa bank pero isang teller lang ang gumagalaw. Even ATMs usually have no money during holidays and paydays when its most needed. Changing of personal information still needs to be done physically in the bank where it takes hours to wait in line. Kung di lang metrobank ang payroll ko, tagal ko na pina close account ko. BPI and BDO has far better service, they should be declared the best managed compared to Metrobank.

review:
I future dated household payroll on the 13th coz I know I‚Äôll be busy on the 15th. On the 15th not all future dated transactions went through. I called the hotline and told them the situation. They told me they went offline and to wait the next day. I told them my employees need the money now. Can I just cancel the transaction and then do a dated one. He said no and best way is to wait tomorrow. Given that the employees needed their money I gave them cash. Then half a day later some of them went through. So I had to get back the cash for some.

The day became more complicated. The hotline person didn‚Äôt have empathy and kept saying just check the next day. I don‚Äôt recommend using this app if you want to have confidence doing future dated transactions and peace of mind. It has been several times that my future dated transactions did not push through. Terrible service and terrible app.

review:
The Metrobank app is a complete disappointment. The interface is confusing, and it's difficult to navigate through the different features. The app frequently crashes or freezes, and I've had to uninstall and reinstall it multiple times just to get it to work properly.

Even when the app does work, it's slow and unresponsive. Transactions take forever to process, and there's no real-time updating of account balances or transactions. I've also had issues with the app not recognizing my login credentials, even though I know they're correct.

Overall, I would not recommend the Metrobank app to anyone. It's unreliable, frustrating to use, and lacks basic features that other banking apps have. Save yourself the trouble and look for a different bank with a better app.

developerResponse: {'id': 37986543, 'body': "Hi Mauuuuwiii, we're sorry for any inconvenience. As of this writing, there are no reported system issues related.\\r\\n\\r\\nThere may have been intermittent system issues with One-Time Password (OTP) due to the following:\\r\\n\\r\\nPlease note that receipt of the OTP depends on the mobile network used.\\r\\n\\r\\n- Connectivity problem & other constraints of the accredited provider (i.e. signal or network downtime)\\r\\n- Connectivity problem & other constraints on the subscribers‚Äô side (i.e. sim problem, phone problem, low on telco signal, etc.)\\r\\n\\r\\nOne-Time Password (OTP) is being sent to the registered mobile number you have nominated upon enrollment to Metrobank Online or Metrobank Mobile Banking App facility. \\r\\n\\r\\nIf your mobile number is updated, may we recommend that you close then reopen the application. If you are using an android device, you may clear cache the app by going to system settings and application management option. \\r\\n\\r\\nIn case your mobile number has changed, you may update through any Metrobank branch. Kindly bring one (1) valid photo-bearing government-issued ID with signature for verification. \\r\\n\\r\\nIf the error persists, please call our 24/7 Customer Service Hotline (+632-88700-700 or domestic toll-free number 1-800-1888-5775) for further assistance on troubleshooting your device. Thank you.", 'modified': '2023-07-31T03:23:15Z'}

developerResponse: {'id': 37133978, 'body': "Hi Tuybits, we're sorry for any inconvenience.\\n\\nTo enroll your Metrobank credit card to our new Metrobank App, please follow the below steps:\\n\\n1. Go to side navigation menu, then select My Accounts. Click on +Enroll. User provides Account Number/ Card Number. \\n2. If user provides 16 digit account number of Credit Card, two (2) more information/ fields are requested: Name on Card and Date of Birth. \\n3. Enroll is enabled once all fields are filled out. Click Enroll. Validation happens if card is valid.\\n4. Input OTP sent via SMS, then press Next to verify mobile number. \\n5. Once verified, Success screen is shown. Account will be listed in the app under Credit Card Tab.\\n\\nShould you have other concerns, please feel free to message us again. Thank you.", 'modified': '2023-06-15T07:46:36Z'}

review: Hassle. Why there is need of OTP I just need to log in. What is passcode won't work? Is this the same with PIN?
title: Why there is an OTP whenever I just need to log in?
developerResponse: {'id': 37109390, 'body': "Hi francowolf, we're sorry to read about your experience. Please be advised that the Metrobank passcode is a new security feature of Metrobank Online and the new Metrobank App. You are required to nominate a 6-digit code upon first log-in. You need to remember this passcode as it will be required in every transaction. However, the OTP is being generated every time you make transactions online to verify and confirm that the online transaction has been requested by the account holder. We have created a case under ticket number AppJun 9, 2023, 14:18BOF\\r. Please allow us to take a look at the issue by sending us more details via our official Facebook page or e-mail us at customercare@metrobank.com.ph. title: credit card enrollment is impossible
developerResponse: {'id': 34469601, 'body': "Hi haerinhyein, we are sorry that you're having issues with our new Metrobank App.  \\n\\nTo enroll your Metrobank credit card to our new Metrobank App, please follow the below steps:\\n\\n1. Go to side navigation menu, then select My Accounts. Click on +Enroll. User provides Account Number/ Card Number. \\n2. If user provides 16 digit account number of Credit Card, 2 more information/ fields are requested (Name on Card and Date of Birth). \\n3. Enroll is enabled once all fields are filled out. Click Enroll. Validation happens if card is valid. \\n4. Input OTP sent via SMS, then press Next to verify mobile number. \\n5. Once verified, Success screen is shown. Account will be listed in the app under Credit Card Tab.\\n\\nIf the issue remains unresolved, please call our 24/7 Customer Service Hotline (+632-88700-700 or domestic toll-free number 1-800-1888-5775) for further assistance or email us at customercare@metrobank.com.ph with the subject line App1/23/2023, 00:00ES\\r as your ticket number. As of this writing, there are no reported system issues related.\\n\\nPlease be advised that there may have been intermittent system issues with One-Time Password (OTP) due to the following:\\n\\nPlease note that receipt of the OTP depends on the mobile network used.\\n\\r\\n- Connectivity problem & other constraints of the accredited provider (i.e. signal or network downtime)\\r\\n- Connectivity problem & other constraints on the subscribers‚Äô side (i.e. sim problem, phone problem, low on telco signal, etc.)\\r\\n\\r\\nOne-Time Password (OTP) is being sent to the registered mobile number you have nominated upon enrollment to Metrobank Online or Metrobank Mobile Banking App facility.\\r\\n\\nIf your mobile number is updated, may we recommend that you close then reopen the application. If you are using an android device, you may clear cache the app by going to system settings and application management option.\\n\\nIn case your mobile number has changed, you may update through any Metrobank branch. Kindly bring one (1) valid photo-bearing government-issued ID with signature for verification.\\n\\nIf the error persists, please call our 24/7 Customer Service Hotline (+632-88700-700 or domestic toll-free number 1-800-1888-5775) for further assistance on troubleshooting your device.\\n\\nShould you have other concerns, please feel free to message us again. Thank you.", 'modified': '2023-06-19T06:35:46Z'}

title: Stupid App

review: We‚Äôre now end of July 2023 and it looks like many bugs on the app have been fixed. When the new app came out I didn‚Äôt want to install because like all new apps, they are usually bad since it seems nowadays that IT developers prefer to use their client as testers rather than follow the SDLC to properly develop and test applications. This choice is somewhat very poor in my opinion as some customers will just run away specially when it comes to online banking. A poorly developed and tested app says a lot about the bank‚Äôs practices. I finally decided few days ago to install the new MetroBank app (IOS). I was honestly a bit scared reading all the negative comments. Yet, i was happily surprised. The download was fairly fast and the setup easy. I have been a regular user of MetroBank online banking both on the old app and on their website. On their website, long ago, I had already set my 6 digit passcode. Since I use always the same on many apps, it wasn‚Äôt hard for me to remember it. So in short , I was able to login the app, using the same username and password as in the old app, with added steps of entering my 6 digit code and then another code sent via SMS. You can tick the box ¬´ remember device ¬ª so it‚Äôs faster next login. You can also activate facial recognition and then it‚Äôs even easier to login. In the app, it‚Äôs fairly easy to use. Nothing fancy. I just find everything I need where it‚Äôs supposed to be. Sometimes it can be a bit slow but it may be because of the internet connection. Twice in 2 days I was able to send money to third parties without a glitch. That‚Äôs the function I most use. So don‚Äôt be scared to install the new app. Make sure you have your 6 digit code at hand, that your mobile number is set properly for your account, if you have used before the old app on a regular basis then the transition to the new app should be easy. Hope this comments helps. Cheers.

review: Why is there no option to give this a ‚Äúzero star‚Äù rating. This app is so bad. Log in is so slow and buggy that even with a stable and fast connection it takes too long to log in and sometimes does not even recognizes your credentials. Once logged in, why the need for a landing page letting you choose to go to your accounts or to scan a qr code? Users log in to check on their account and that is the priority and not to scan a qr code which is a low priority if not the least. That landing page slows the users down when checking their account since checking on your accounts also takes too much time to load. Other features from the old app is missing or might have been buried in some menu or procedures in the new app, which only goes to show that that new app is not very intuitive to use. You should have hired a UX designer or a better one if you do have one.  Even if the UX is passable, you should have paid more attention to the stability and usability of the app before deploying this to the public. It adds more frustration to the using public and more tasks on your end.

title: New Metrobank App
developerResponse: {'id': 37134119, 'body': 'Hi Vina tfs, thank you for reaching out regarding non-receipt of your One-Time Password (OTP). \\r\\n\\r\\nOur apologies for any inconvenience this may have caused. As of this writing, there are no reported system issues related.\\r\\n\\r\\nPlease be advised that there may have been intermittent system issues with One-Time Password (OTP) due to the following:\\r\\n\\r\\nPlease note that receipt of the OTP depends on the mobile network used.\\r\\n\\r\\n- Connectivity problem & other constraints of the accredited provider (i.e. signal or network downtime)\\r\\n- Connectivity problem & other constraints on the subscribers‚Äô side (i.e. sim problem, phone problem, low on telco signal, etc.)\\r\\n\\r\\nOne-Time Password (OTP) is being sent to the registered mobile number you have nominated upon enrollment to Metrobank Online or Metrobank Mobile Banking App facility. \\r\\n\\r\\nIf your mobile number is updated, may we recommend that you close then reopen the application. If you are using an android device, you may clear cache the app by going to system settings and application management option. \\r\\n\\r\\nIn case your mobile number has changed, you may update through any Metrobank branch. Kindly bring one (1) valid photo-bearing government-issued ID with signature for verification. \\r\\n\\r\\nIf the error persists, please call our 24/7 Customer Service Hotline (+632-88700-700 or domestic toll-free number 1-800-1888-5775) for further assistance on troubleshooting your device.\\r\\n\\r\\nShould you have other concerns, please feel free to message us again. Thank you.', 'modified': '2023-06-15T07:53:10Z'}
